etymologies: late Middle English (in swage (sense 2 of the noun)): from Old French souage ‘decorative groove’, of unknown origin

definitions: a shaped tool or die for giving a desired form to metal by hammering or pressure.
shortDefinitions: shaped tool or die for giving desired form to metal by hammering

definitions: a groove, ridge, or other molding on an object.
shortDefinitions: groove, ridge, or other moulding on object

definitions: shape (metal) using a swage, especially in order to reduce its cross section

examples.text: the instrument has a swaging head and a pulsed action which flattens the rivet in a series of rolling motions

definitions: join (metal pieces) together by swaging process

examples.text: eye-ends in corrosion-resisting steel swaged on aircraft control cables

shortDefinitions: join metal pieces together by this process
